outline:
1. to fret, be sad, be wroth, be vexed, be enraged, be out of humour
    1. (Qal)
      1. to be out of humour
      2. to be enraged, be angry
    2. (Qal)
      1. to appear perplexed, appear troubled
      2. to be sad-looking
kjv_def: fret, sad, worse liking, be wroth.
strongs_def: properly, to boil up, i.e. (figuratively) to be peevish or angry
